    Starting with Names

    starting-with-names.Rmd
    library(convo)
    names1 <- c("n_a", "n_b", "n_c", "amt_b", "amt_c", "amt_d")

    Create a convo object

    convo1 <- parse_stubs(names1)
print(convo1)
#> Level 1
#> - n
#> - amt
#>  Level 2
#> - a
#> - b
#> - c
#> - d

    The default separator is an underscore ('_'), but we can instead specify other seperators such as a period. However, since convo::parse_stubs() utilizes regex for splitting, we must use escape characters before the dot (e.g. \\.) so that this is not represented as a wildcard.

    names2 <- c("n.a", "n.q", "ind.c", "ind.d", "ind.f")
convo2 <- parse_stubs(names2, sep = "\\.")

    Comparing convo objects

    In convo1 but not convo2:

    compare_convo(convo1, convo2, setdiff)
#> Level 1
#> - amt
#>  Level 2
#> - b

    In convo2 but not convo1:

    compare_convo(convo2, convo1, setdiff)
#> Level 1
#> - ind
#>  Level 2
#> - q
#> - f

    In either convo1 or convo2:

    compare_convo(convo1, convo2, union)
#> Level 1
#> - n
#> - amt
#> - ind
#>  Level 2
#> - a
#> - b
#> - c
#> - d
#> - q
#> - f

    In both convo1 and convo2:

    compare_convo(convo1, convo2, union)
#> Level 1
#> - n
#> - amt
#> - ind
#>  Level 2
#> - a
#> - b
#> - c
#> - d
#> - q
#> - f

    Thus, can use to make new convos:

    convo3 <- compare_convo(convo1, convo2, intersect)

    Create a YAML template

    tmp <- tempfile("convo", fileext = ".yml")
write_convo(convo3, filename = "convo-config.yml", path = tempdir())
    - desc: ~
  req: ~
  stubs:
  - stub: 'n'
    desc: ~
    valid: ~
- desc: ~
  req: ~
  stubs:
  - stub: a
    desc: ~
    valid: ~
  - stub: c
    desc: ~
    valid: ~
  - stub: d
    desc: ~
    valid: ~

    Note that 'n' is automatically placed in quotes because yaml interprets raw n and y to denote no and yes.
